titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 393
CWG12534

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: Union Artillery, Navy and Marines Primary Source Documents ; Misc U.S.C.T. Primary Source Documents
msIdentifier.idno: Box 14, Folder 1st INDEPENDENT BTRY LT. ARTY OFFICERS

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, July 24th, 1865.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 393.
(Extract.)
26. The following named officer, (published officially July 3d, 1865,) having failed to appear before the Military Commission, instituted by Special Orders, No. 53, series of 1863, from the War Department, within the prescribed time, the President directs that they be dismissed the service of the United States, to date July 3d, 1865, for the causes set opposite their respective names: --

1st Lieutenant William F. Sinclair, 1st Battery Kentucky Light Artillery.
By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
E D Townsend
Assistant Adjutant General.

1 Indpt Batty Arty
Sinclair Wm. F.
1' Lieut
Order
dismissing him from service.
Entd
Recd A. G. O. Aug 4 1865
